GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: serves one article selected by id

article.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
article.author: butter_bridge

GET /api/articles.description: serves an array of all articles sorted by date in descending order, where each article has the attributes as shown in below example

articles.title: UNCOVERED: catspiracy to bring down democracy
articles.author: rogersop

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: serves an array of comments for the given article_id sorted by their created_at attribute in descending order

comments.body: I am 100% sure that we're not completely sure.
comments.author: butter_bridge

comments.body: What do you see? I have no idea where this will lead us. This place I speak of, is known as the Black Lodge.
comments.author: icellusedkars

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: Adds a new comment to an article and responds with the posted comment

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: Updates and returns the selected article in accordance with the input body, where { inc_votes : 1 } will increment the vote property of given article by 1 and inc_votes: -100 will decrement it by 100

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: it should delete the given comment by comment_id and respond with status 204 and no content

GET /api/users.description: serves an array of all users
